Top/Classifieds/Job Market/Job Categories/Government, Philanthropy and NGO

block.p: The governor unveiled his priorities for the rest of the legislative session this week, but lawmakers offered up their own wish list items. Among the more notable was one by Senator Dean G. Skelos, left, a Long Island Republican and the deputy majority leader, who said he would introduce legislation to bring back tax incentives for hybrid electric vehicles. On another front, Assemblymen Keith L. T. Wright of Harlem and Hakeem Jeffries of Brooklyn said they would be introducing legislation ''aimed at acknowledging and making an official apology for the role of New York State in the transatlantic and domestic slave trade.''

The governor unveiled his priorities for the rest of the legislative session this week, but lawmakers offered up their own wish list items. Among the more notable was one by Senator Dean G. Skelos, left, a Long Island Republican and the deputy majority leader, who said he would introduce legislation to bring back tax incentives for hybrid electric vehicles. On another front, Assemblymen Keith L. T. Wright of Harlem and Hakeem Jeffries of Brooklyn said they would be introducing legislation ''aimed at acknowledging and making an official apology for the role of New York State in the transatlantic and domestic slave trade.''

The governor's priority remains campaign finance legislation, which he is negotiating with legislative leaders; this week he is also expected to provide more detail on his plan to crack down on sexually explicit and violent video games.
